level.heading: Taxation without representation federal tax pay-out message board installation.

level.text: Notwithstanding any other law or regulation, the Council of the District of Columbia shall install, adjacent to the outside front wall of the John A. Wilson Building, a programmable electronic message board sign showing the dollar amount of federal taxes paid by the residents of the District of Columbia.

Notwithstanding any other law or regulation, the Mayor shall install, on public space within 200 feet of the baseball stadium, currently called Nationals Park, a programmable electronic message board sign showing the dollar amount of federal taxes paid by the residents of the District of Columbia.

The signs shall be large enough for the public to easily read and designed and placed in such a location so as not to deter from the architectural character of the exterior of the John A. Wilson Building or the exterior of Nationals Park.

Preference for the design, manufacture, installation, and maintenance of the signs shall be given to businesses certified as small, local, or disadvantaged business enterprises by the Department of Small and Local Business Development.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 17-232
level.text: Law 17-232, the "Taxation Without Representation Federal Tax Pay-Out Message Board Installation Act of 2008", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-28, which was referred to the Committee on the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 1, 2008, and July 15, 2008, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 28, 2008, it was assigned Act No. 17-472 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-232 became effective on October 21, 2008.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Section 3 of D.C. Law 17-232 provided that Section 2(b) shall apply upon the inclusion of its fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan.
